head.title: The Education Of a Holy Warrior

hedline.hl1: The Education Of a Holy Warrior

block.p: So the magazine decided to run a bogeyman story for summer nights around the campfire? I don't doubt Jeffrey Goldberg's (June 25) reporting of the curriculum and attitudes of the students at Haqqania; but he provides no context for understanding where they come from and why they think as they do. Goldberg provides only sterotypes, leering asides and snide comments about a man's teeth that no editor would accept, except that the ''hillbilly'' in this case is Muslim. He also fails to mention the fate of most of these boys: death from disease, malnutrition or fighting -- not with Americans or Hindus, but other Muslims.
Shoshana Keller Department of History Hamilton College Clinton, N.Y.
